The number of confirmed COVID-19 cases in West Sussex so far as at 27 March is 41,321 (4,782.6 cases per 100,000 population). In the seven days to 22 March, there were 260 new confirmed cases (30.1 new cases per 100,000). In the seven days to 15 March, there were 311 new cases, and so the new cases have decreased by 16% (51 fewer cases).
